reviews.review: Crowbar simulator 2

It’s hard for me to write anything that isn’t better described by @Campster in his old Errant Signal video already, so I’ll consider it required reading before progressing… https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q-3gcVICiCs

Long story short, I agree largely with his opinions of HL2, but also the direction of many games still today. The de-emphasis of gameplay “doing” to make the narrative move to instead to provide a cinematic or scripted plot point is a crutch. Many, maybe let’s say “most” games cannot handle the responsible of balancing these elements properly. However, I think Half-Life 2 does. Though Campster seems to belittle the sections of gameplay in HL2, I think it’s perfectly paced, even if shallow in scope. Half-Life 2 doesn’t seem to ask for the overwhelming cheers fans give it; it knows its bounds, a solid FPS experience with a cute story. Yet, such simplicity often yields greater appreciation of beauty. Half-Life 2’s singleplayer experience still holds up today for its clean graphics and sharp yet average gameplay. None of which are particularly damning, since most gameplay today is average or dulled down anyway, HL2 doesn’t just fit in with the contemporary design philosophy, it instead stands on top of the mountain looking down at those who fail at it saying “Slow down, breath, don’t make it harder than it has to be”.

On a side note, Campster on Bioshock Infinite rings through this as well, to wit: HL2’s gameplay is far better, even if gimmicky at times. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GJ2cSKBFBDQ

Half-Life 2 is one of the best game i've ever played. You'll be drawn in with its amazing story while fighting your way through its vast and detailed world. 

The combat system is near perfect and there is a wide choice of weapons at your finger tips. The NPCs are actually helpful to you by fighting the combine or healing you in the fight (medics only), when they're not in you way which isnt too often.

 The level design is great, but i sometimes found myself looking where to go next because i couldn't find the next hallway or door.

 The story is 13 hours long, but every second of it is awesome! Half-Life 2 is a MUST buy!

This is by far the best game I've ever played. My dad started playing this game when it came out in 2004. I was 4 years old and knew that this was a legendary game. 11 years later, with outdated graphics and gameplay mechanics, it is still a revolutionary game worth anyone's time. You can spend hours upon hours playing this physics based shooter. This has been my absolute favorite game for 11 years and will remain my favorite game until the far away day that we see a new Half-Life.

Scénario sympathique, graphisme très bon, half life2 reste un excellent jeu qu'il faut tester. Néanmoins il reste très decevant pour ceux qui ont joué et adoré le 1. Les armes sont beaucoup moins diversifiée, les monstres beaucoup moins nombreux ce qui donne au jeu un aspect beaucoup plus linéaire que le précedent opus.
On ne peux cependant pas en vouloir au concepteurs de ce jeu qui ont dû faire une suite à un jeu qui avait placé la barre très haute.
Quoi qu'il en soit, ceux qui n'ont jamais joué à half-life apprécieront sûrement le 2.

Её ждали. Долго и с надеждами. Больше, чем её ждали разве что Stalker. Её ждали, спрятав в копилке деньги, что бы одному из первых купить заветную коробку. Её ждали и надеялись и она вышла на свет произведя фурор.

Снова Гордон Фримэн. Снова необходимость спасать мир от зла, выпущенного в лабораториях Dark Messa. Снова Half-Life. Сюжет игры прост, но продуман, линеен, но интересен. Он не оставит вас скучать разглядывая огромные пространства, он заставит вас двигаться и стрелять, жечь и взрывать, передвигать предметы и бегать. Игра разбита на несколько миссий, которые по отдельности заслуживают звания шедевр, а значит и сама игра ничуть не хуже.

Игру Half-Life 2 ждали не зря. Она покорила игроков не меньше, чем её первая часть.

The best FPS with good story what I have ever seen.

Half-Life 2 is an open-world First-Person Shooter PC game created by Valve Software, having the purpose of serving as a sequel to Valve's debut title, Half-Life.

Before presenting the game's advantages and overwhelmingly little amount of disadvantages, that I believe everyone knows since almost the entire globe has played this game and/or its prequel, I want to state an opinion on this game. 

This game is legendary, possibly even surpassing Half-Life 1. Everything about this game, to the smallest detail is done perfectly for its time, allowing the creation of this masterpiece of a game. Despite my absolute respect for this franchise, I am completely pissed off how Valve left this game on a cliffhanger, with no real closure to the story, ending the game on a bad note, and I truly wish they would have expanded on the character development and Borealis storyline.

First off, the game's environment is truly gorgeous, and, when combined with the soundtrack and characters with their interactions, gives the game a unique atmosphere, accomplishing the wanted result: An atmosphere of despair and helplessness, that towards the end of the storyline turns into feelings of hope and achievement.

Secondly, the story is very interesting and presents the harsh reality of the in-game world, filled with struggling survivors, the conflict between the Resistance and Combine forces, including the dangers of the creatures of Xen. The story of Borealis would have been very interesting if Valve continued with Half-Life 3.

My last point is that the graphics are perfect for the game's early release time, 2004. The shaders and texture details are very well made and obviously had a lot of work and dedication put into them.

As a closure, I think this game may have been even better than it has if Valve released Half-Life 3. Despite how mad the community is, maybe Gabe Newell is just afraid of not reaching our expectations with the game? With that being said I still believe we did not deserve the game and its storyline to end in such a terrible way with no true completion.

Overall score: 9/10
